    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        Encrypts and then decrypts an inputed string using ROT13 and affine cipher will only encrypt letters, special symbols will be ignored
        Parameters:
        args - user input from the console

      • explainer

        public static void explainer()
        Prints an explanation of what the program will do

      • prompt

        public static java.lang.String prompt(java.util.Scanner input,
                                      java.lang.String question,
                                      java.lang.String intOrLetter)
        Prompts the user for an integer
        Parameters:
        input - scanner object used to get input from user
        question - the question that will prompt the user
        intOrLetter - indicates if int or string is to be collected from user
        Returns:
        userInput the int or string the user inputed in a String

      • verifies

        public static int verifies(java.util.Scanner input,
                           int test,
                           char aOrB)
        Verifies if user inputed valid value for 'a' if value was invalid will re-prompt for a new value for 'a'
        Parameters:
        input - scanner object used to collect user input
        test - the value that will be tested
        aOrB - indicated if 'a' or 'b' is to be tested
        Returns:
        test new 'a' or 'b' or the original value of 'a' or 'b' if it was valid

      • succesTest

        public static void succesTest(java.lang.String originalPhrase,
                              java.lang.String decryptedPhrase)
        Tests to see if phrases were correctly encrypted and decrypted
        Parameters:
        originalPhrase - the original phrase the user inputed
        decryptedPhrase - the phrase which has been encrypted and then decrypted

      • caseCheck

        public static char caseCheck(char character)
        Check to see if a character is upper case or lower case
        Parameters:
        character - the character that will be tested
        Returns:
        letter first letter of the alphabet depending on the case of the character if character is not a letter then returns character

      • rot13

        public static java.lang.String rot13(java.lang.String phrase)
        Encrypts inputed phrase using ROT13, and also decrypts inputed phrase encrypted using ROT13 this is possible because ROT13 is its own inverse since the our alphabet is 26 character long
        Parameters:
        phrase - the phrase that will be encrypted or decrypted using ROT13
        Returns:
        encryptedPhrase the encrypted phrase or decrypted phrase depending on the input

      • affineC

        public static java.lang.String affineC(int a,
                                       int b,
                                       java.lang.String phrase)
        Encrypts inputed phrase using a affine cipher
        Parameters:
        a - the multiplicative factor used for encrypting
        b - the shift factor used for encrypting
        phrase - the phrase that will be encrypted using affine cipher
        Returns:
        encryptedPhrase the phrase encrypted using affine cipher

      • aPrime

        public static int aPrime(int a)
        Finds modular multiplicative inverse of 'a'. it must satisfy the equation a*a^-1 mod m = 1 also first factor of a^-1 will be within range 1-25 so we can search for a^-1
        Parameters:
        a - the multiplicative factor used to find the modular multiplicative inverse
        Returns:
        aPrime modular multiplicative inverse of 'a'

      • decryptAffine

        public static java.lang.String decryptAffine(int a,
                                             int b,
                                             java.lang.String phrase)
        Decrypts inputed phrase encrypted by a affine cipher
        Parameters:
        a - the multiplicative factor used for encrypting
        b - the shift factor used for encrypting
        phrase - the phrase that will be decrypted
        Returns:
        decryptedPhrase the result of applying the decryption algorithm to an encrypted phrase
